440.name: Abomination
440.flavorText: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

242.name: Abusive Sergeant
242.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
242.flavorText: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

1659.name: Acolyte of Pain
1659.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
1659.flavorText: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

113180.name: Aegwynn, the Guardian
113180.text: Spell Damage +2 Deathrattle: The next minion you draw inherits these powers.
113180.flavorText: With Medivh as her son, nothing YOU do could ever disappoint her.

32.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
32.flavorText: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords. And the other three don't let him forget it.

1658.name: Alarm-o-Bot
1658.text: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand.

1167.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
1167.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
1167.flavorText: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

56583.name: Aldrachi Warblades
56583.flavorText: The ancient Aldrachi were the greatest warriors in the universe. Imagine their power if they'd put the handle at the END of the blade.

581.name: Alexstrasza
581.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
581.flavorText: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone. Except Deathwing. And Malygos. And Nekros.

113183.name: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder
113183.text: Battlecry: Choose a character. If it's friendly, restore 8 Health. If it's an enemy, deal 8 damage.

790.name: Amani Berserker
790.flavorText: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

149.name: Ancestral Healing
149.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
149.flavorText: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

404.name: Ancestral Spirit
404.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
404.flavorText: It was just a flesh wound.

186.name: Ancient Brewmaster
186.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
186.flavorText: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak. But apparently that's a compliment.

915.name: Ancient Mage
915.flavorText: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

605.name: Ancient Watcher
605.flavorText: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

920.name: Ancient of Lore
920.text: Choose One - Draw 2 cards; or Restore 7 Health.
920.flavorText: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

1035.name: Ancient of War
1035.flavorText: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?" You lose if you get crushed to death.

1688.name: Angry Chicken
1688.flavorText: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

437.name: Animal Companion
437.flavorText: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer! Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

538.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
538.flavorText: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

54837.name: Arcane Devourer
54837.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2/+2.
54837.flavorText: Likes her magic with a pinch of salt.

447.name: Arcane Explosion
447.text: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.
447.flavorText: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

466.name: Arcane Golem
466.text: Charge. Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
466.flavorText: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

555.name: Arcane Intellect
555.flavorText: Playing this card makes you SMARTER. And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

564.name: Arcane Missiles
564.text: Deal 3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
564.flavorText: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

877.name: Arcane Shot
877.flavorText: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves. The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

304.name: Arcanite Reaper
304.flavorText: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

525.name: Archmage
525.flavorText: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

1080.name: Archmage Antonidas
1080.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
1080.flavorText: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor. This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

281.name: Argent Commander
281.flavorText: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

1022.name: Argent Protector
1022.flavorText: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs. I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

757.name: Argent Squire
757.flavorText: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

596.name: Armorsmith
596.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
596.flavorText: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

421.name: Assassin's Blade
421.flavorText: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin. Certificate of authenticity included.

345.name: Assassinate
345.flavorText: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

237.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
237.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
237.flavorText: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

1174.name: Avenging Wrath
1174.text: Deal 8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
1174.flavorText: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

825.name: Azure Drake
825.flavorText: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

180.name: Backstab
180.text: Deal 2 damage to an undamaged minion.
180.flavorText: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

23.name: Bane of Doom
23.text: Deal 3 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
23.flavorText: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

336.name: Baron Geddon
336.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
336.flavorText: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

400.name: Battle Rage
400.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
400.flavorText: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

903.name: Bestial Wrath
903.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
903.flavorText: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface. Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

282.name: Betrayal
282.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
282.flavorText: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

1657.name: Big Game Hunter
1657.text: Tradeable Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.
1657.flavorText: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him. Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

577.name: Bite
577.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn. Gain 4 Armor.

1064.name: Blade Flurry
1064.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.
1064.flavorText: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast. It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

1522.name: Blessed Champion
1522.flavorText: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

943.name: Blessing of Kings
943.flavorText: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

70.name: Blessing of Might
70.flavorText: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

1373.name: Blessing of Wisdom
1373.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
1373.flavorText: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

457.name: Blizzard
457.text: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
457.flavorText: This spell can be very Entertaining.

469.name: Blood Imp
469.text: Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
469.flavorText: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

755.name: Blood Knight
755.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
755.flavorText: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

1171.name: Bloodlust
1171.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.

749.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
749.flavorText: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

997.name: Bloodsail Corsair
997.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
997.flavorText: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers. It's called the "Pirate's Code".

103098.name: Bloodsail Deckhand
103098.text: Battlecry: The next weapon you play costs (1) less.

999.name: Bloodsail Raider
999.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
999.flavorText: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

739.name: Bluegill Warrior
739.flavorText: He just wants a hug. A sloppy... slimy... hug.

113189.name: Bonedigger Geist
113189.flavorText: He's a grave-half-full kind of geist.

1140.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
1140.flavorText: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

1686.name: Boulderfist Ogre
1686.flavorText: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

75.name: Brawl
75.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
75.flavorText: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

54839.name: Brightwing
54839.text: Battlecry: Add a random Legendary minion to your hand.
54839.flavorText: Little faerie dragons are made of sugar and spice and maniacal vice.

272.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
272.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
272.flavorText: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

420.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
420.flavorText: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck. It's pretty insensitive.

52263.name: Call of the Void
52263.text: Add a random Demon to your hand.

456.name: Captain Greenskin
456.flavorText: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

530.name: Captain's Parrot
530.text: Battlecry: Draw a Pirate from your deck.
530.flavorText: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.

36.name: Cenarius
36.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
36.flavorText: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

57847.name: Chaos Nova
57847.flavorText: Illin' Illidan laying down the damage, flinging out the chaos as far as he can manage.

56791.name: Chaos Strike
56791.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn. Draw a card.
56791.flavorText: "What do we want?" "CHAOS!" "When do we want it?" "WHEN LEAST EXPECTED!"

344.name: Charge
344.text: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
344.flavorText: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

90.name: Chillwind Yeti
90.flavorText: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

1050.name: Claw
1050.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn. Gain 2 Armor.
1050.flavorText: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

940.name: Cleave
940.text: Deal 2 damage to two random enemy minions.
940.flavorText: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

268.name: Cold Blood
268.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
268.flavorText: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

1016.name: Coldlight Oracle
1016.flavorText: They can see the future. In that future both players draw more cards. Spoooky.

453.name: Coldlight Seer
453.flavorText: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths. So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

1026.name: Commanding Shout
1026.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
1026.flavorText: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

990.name: Conceal
990.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
990.flavorText: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions. You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

430.name: Cone of Cold
430.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal 1 damage to them.
430.flavorText: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

476.name: Consecration
476.flavorText: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy. But it smells a little, too.

56792.name: Coordinated Strike
56792.flavorText: Undisputed champions of "Dancing with the Satyrs."

1687.name: Core Hound
1687.flavorText: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

113187.name: Corrupted Ashbringer
113187.flavorText: Put your faith in the blight!

982.name: Corruption
982.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
982.flavorText: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOOM! Corrupted!

113.name: Counterspell
113.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
113.flavorText: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't? The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

801.name: Crazed Alchemist
801.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
801.flavorText: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

285.name: Cruel Taskmaster
285.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
285.flavorText: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

811.name: Cult Master
811.text: After a friendly minion dies, draw a card.
811.flavorText: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

175.name: Dalaran Mage
175.flavorText: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

348.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
348.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
348.flavorText: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore. Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

582.name: Darkscale Healer
582.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
582.flavorText: Healing is just something she does in her free time. It's more of a hobby really.

459.name: Deadly Poison
459.flavorText: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells. Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison? Poison Elemental? Nobody wants that.

1093.name: Deadly Shot
1093.flavorText: Our ballista operator is effective, but not picky.

834.name: Deathwing
834.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
834.flavorText: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated. Daddy issues?

763.name: Defender of Argus
763.flavorText: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending. But it does.

201.name: Defias Ringleader
201.flavorText: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

113190.name: Defrost
113190.text: Draw a card. Spend 2 Corpses to draw another.
113190.flavorText: Shouldn't this NOT be a Frost spell?

979.name: Demolisher
979.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
979.flavorText: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone. It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

1142.name: Demonfire
1142.text: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
1142.flavorText: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

985.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
985.flavorText: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

679.name: Divine Favor
679.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
679.flavorText: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

1361.name: Divine Spirit
1361.flavorText: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

631.name: Doomguard
631.flavorText: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

352.name: Doomhammer
352.flavorText: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall. His name is a total coincidence.

138.name: Doomsayer
138.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
138.flavorText: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

523.name: Dragonling Mechanic
523.flavorText: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

919.name: Drain Life
919.text: Deal 2 damage. Restore 2 Health to your hero.
919.flavorText: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

878.name: Dread Corsair
878.text: Taunt Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
878.flavorText: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

1019.name: Dread Infernal
1019.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
1019.flavorText: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

692.name: Druid of the Claw
692.text: Choose One - Transform into a 7/6 with Rush; or a 4/9 with Taunt.
692.flavorText: Cat or Bear? Cat or Bear?! I just cannot CHOOSE!

618.name: Dust Devil
618.flavorText: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

1662.name: Eaglehorn Bow
1662.text: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
1662.flavorText: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

767.name: Earth Shock
767.text: Silence a minion, then deal 1 damage to it.
767.flavorText: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

1651.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
1651.flavorText: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

306.name: Edwin VanCleef
306.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each other card you've played this turn.
306.flavorText: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

1754.name: Elite Tauren Chieftain
1754.text: Battlecry: Give both players the power to ROCK! (with a Power Chord card)
1754.flavorText: He's looking for a drummer. The current candidates are: Novice Engineer, Sen'jin Shieldmasta', and Ragnaros the Firelord.

389.name: Elven Archer
389.flavorText: Don't bother asking her out on a date. She'll shoot you down.

113350.name: Emerald Skytalon
113350.flavorText: Sworn protectors of Ysera at the Emerald Dragonshrine, these majestic owls have been touched by the powers of the Emerald Dream, taking on an almost crystalline appearance.

1098.name: Emperor Cobra
1098.flavorText: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray. And plate armor.

89148.name: Enslaved Fel Lord
89148.text: Taunt. Also damages the minions next to whomever this attacks.
89148.flavorText: He's not really chained up. He just wears that to scare the imps when they get too unruly.

756.name: Equality
756.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
756.flavorText: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

1737.name: Ethereal Arcanist
1737.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
1737.flavorText: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

904.name: Eviscerate
904.flavorText: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent. You might tweak your elbow! That really hurts!

394.name: Explosive Shot
394.text: Deal 5 damage to a minion and 2 damage to adjacent ones.
394.flavorText: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot. Then duck.

585.name: Explosive Trap
585.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal 2 damage to all enemies.
585.flavorText: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

462.name: Eye for an Eye
462.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
462.flavorText: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

531.name: Faceless Manipulator
531.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
531.flavorText: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

609.name: Faerie Dragon
609.flavorText: Adorable. Immune to Magic. Doesn't pee on the rug. The perfect pet!

667.name: Fan of Knives
667.text: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
667.flavorText: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

818.name: Far Sight
818.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
818.flavorText: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

517.name: Felguard
517.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
517.flavorText: Yes, he'll fight for you. BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

103102.name: Felsoul Jailer
103102.text: Battlecry: Your opponent discards a minion. Deathrattle: Return it.
103102.flavorText: He can lock 'em up, but he just can't keep 'em.

592.name: Felstalker
592.flavorText: This puppy chews up cards instead of shoes.

602.name: Fen Creeper
602.flavorText: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast. Boom, New Name!

238.name: Feral Spirit
238.flavorText: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

401.name: Fiery War Axe
401.flavorText: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

189.name: Fire Elemental
189.flavorText: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

315.name: Fireball
315.flavorText: This spell is useful for burning things. If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

1090.name: Flame Imp
1090.flavorText: Imps like being on fire. They just do.

1004.name: Flamestrike
1004.text: Deal 5 damage to all enemy minions.
1004.flavorText: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

1008.name: Flametongue Totem
1008.flavorText: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems. There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

896.name: Flare
896.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
896.flavorText: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

397.name: Flesheating Ghoul
397.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
397.flavorText: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name. It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

103100.name: Focused Will
103100.text: Silence a minion, then give it +3 Health.
103100.flavorText: Extreme focus is almost as effective as a really flashy distraction.

493.name: Force of Nature
493.flavorText: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

299.name: Forked Lightning
299.text: Deal 2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
299.flavorText: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

519.name: Freezing Trap
519.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand. It costs (2) more.
519.flavorText: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

512.name: Frost Elemental
512.flavorText: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

587.name: Frost Nova
587.flavorText: Hey man, that's cold. Literally and metaphorically.

971.name: Frost Shock
971.text: Deal 1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.

662.name: Frostbolt
662.text: Deal 3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
662.flavorText: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

41.name: Frostwolf Grunt
41.flavorText: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that. It's more than just a job.

496.name: Frostwolf Warlord
496.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
496.flavorText: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley. Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

654.name: Frothing Berserker
654.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
654.flavorText: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

932.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
932.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
932.flavorText: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

858.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
858.flavorText: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor. He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.

54833.name: Gift of the Wild
54833.flavorText: The gift that keeps on living.

311.name: Gladiator's Longbow
311.flavorText: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

58494.name: Glaivebound Adept
58494.text: Battlecry: If your hero attacked this turn, deal 4 damage.
58494.flavorText: "Initiate, this is your glaive. Think of it as an extension of yourself... Did you just throw it?!"

308.name: Gnomish Inventor
308.flavorText: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

922.name: Goldshire Footman
922.flavorText: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

810.name: Gorehowl
810.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
810.flavorText: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe. Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession. Quite the mystery!

113191.name: Graveyard Shift
113191.flavorText: "Why are we even open at night? This place is dead!"

510.name: Grimscale Oracle
510.flavorText: These are the brainy murlocs. It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

338.name: Grommash Hellscream
338.flavorText: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes! Maybe not his best decision.

526.name: Gruul
526.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
526.flavorText: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller". He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

1068.name: Guardian of Kings
1068.flavorText: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

768.name: Gurubashi Berserker
768.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

250.name: Hammer of Wrath
250.flavorText: A good paladin has many tools. Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

727.name: Hand of Protection
727.flavorText: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

912.name: Harrison Jones
912.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
912.flavorText: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

778.name: Harvest Golem
778.flavorText: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

708.name: Headcrack
708.text: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
708.flavorText: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

113185.name: Heart Strike
113185.text: Deal 3 damage to a minion. If that kills it, gain a Corpse.

950.name: Hellfire
950.flavorText: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

1007.name: Heroic Strike
1007.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
1007.flavorText: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

766.name: Hex
766.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
766.flavorText: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

54840.name: High Inquisitor Whitemane
54840.text: Battlecry: Summon all friendly minions that died this turn.
54840.flavorText: No one told her that champions want to sleep in.

640.name: Hogger
640.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
640.flavorText: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

1365.name: Holy Fire
1365.text: Deal 5 damage. Restore 5 Health to your hero.

291.name: Holy Light
291.flavorText: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

841.name: Holy Nova
841.text: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions. Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
841.flavorText: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell. Also, you're probably a jerk.

279.name: Holy Smite
279.flavorText: It doesn't matter how pious you are. Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

435.name: Holy Wrath
435.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its Cost.

1003.name: Houndmaster
1003.flavorText: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks. It's rhetorical.

854.name: Humility
854.flavorText: This card makes something really damp. Oh wait. That's "Humidity."

141.name: Hunter's Mark
141.flavorText: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

621.name: Ice Barrier
621.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
621.flavorText: This is Rank 1. Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

192.name: Ice Block
192.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
192.flavorText: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

172.name: Ice Lance
172.text: Freeze a character. If it was already Frozen, deal 4 damage instead.
172.flavorText: The trick is not to break the lance. Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces." Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

52255.name: Icicle
52255.text: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it's Frozen, draw a card.
52255.flavorText: This may appear weak at frost glance, but it's actually a very ice spell.

926.name: Imp Master
926.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp.
926.flavorText: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

1109.name: Injured Blademaster
1109.flavorText: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

59867.name: Inner Demon
59867.text: Give your hero +8 Attack this turn.
59867.flavorText: Critical component of any tragic backstory.

376.name: Inner Fire
376.text: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
376.flavorText: Good idea: Buffing your minions. Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

22.name: Inner Rage
22.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
22.flavorText: They're only smiling on the outside.

254.name: Innervate
254.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
254.flavorText: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

290.name: Ironbeak Owl
290.flavorText: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

921.name: Jungle Panther
921.flavorText: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

601.name: Keeper of the Grove
601.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
601.flavorText: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

287.name: Kidnapper
287.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
287.flavorText: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

296.name: Kill Command
296.text: Deal 3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal 5 damage instead.

1144.name: King Krush
1144.flavorText: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

1693.name: King Mukla
1693.flavorText: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

748.name: Kirin Tor Mage
748.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
748.flavorText: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran. How do you make a Dalaran float? Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

1073.name: Knife Juggler
1073.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
1073.flavorText: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers. They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

672.name: Kobold Geomancer
672.flavorText: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

28.name: Kor'kron Elite
28.flavorText: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

103103.name: Kor'vas Bloodthorn
103103.text: Charge, Lifesteal After you play a card with Outcast, return this to your hand.
103103.flavorText: Illidan taught her that demon hunters should sacrifice EVERYTHING… but she still brought Lifesteal just in case.

60068.name: Kul Tiran Chaplain
60068.flavorText: The maritime Kul Tiran clergy are unique among priests for using holy saltwater.

864.name: Lava Burst
864.flavorText: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

559.name: Leeroy Jenkins
559.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
559.flavorText: At least he has Angry Chicken.

658.name: Leper Gnome
658.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
658.flavorText: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

383.name: Light's Justice
383.flavorText: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

505.name: Lightning Bolt
505.flavorText: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

629.name: Lightning Storm
629.text: Deal 3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (1)
629.flavorText: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

886.name: Lightspawn
886.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
886.flavorText: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

1655.name: Lightwarden
1655.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
1655.flavorText: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

797.name: Lightwell
797.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
797.flavorText: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

777.name: Lord Jaraxxus
777.flavorText: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

113201.name: Lord Marrowgar
113201.text: Battlecry: Raise ALL of your Corpses as 1/1 Risen Golems with Rush. For each that can't fit, give one +2/+2.
113201.flavorText: And now, Lord Marrowgar with the weather.

157.name: Lord of the Arena
157.flavorText: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

1135.name: Lorewalker Cho
1135.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
1135.flavorText: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

762.name: Mad Bomber
762.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
762.flavorText: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

1653.name: Magma Rager
1653.flavorText: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

436.name: Malygos
436.flavorText: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic. He gets so mad!

12.name: Mana Addict
12.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
12.flavorText: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

513.name: Mana Tide Totem
513.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
513.flavorText: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

715.name: Mana Wraith
715.flavorText: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

405.name: Mana Wyrm
405.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
405.flavorText: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

151.name: Mark of Nature
151.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
151.flavorText: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature." Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

213.name: Mark of the Wild
213.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+3. (+2 Attack/+3 Health)
213.flavorText: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

1366.name: Mass Dispel
1366.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
1366.flavorText: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

351.name: Master Swordsmith
351.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
351.flavorText: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

887.name: Master of Disguise
887.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.
887.flavorText: She's actually a male tauren. People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

545.name: Mind Blast
545.text: Deal 5 damage to the enemy hero.
545.flavorText: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

8.name: Mind Control
8.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
8.flavorText: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

734.name: Mind Control Tech
734.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one.
734.flavorText: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

1099.name: Mind Vision
1099.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
1099.flavorText: I see what you did there.

145.name: Mindgames
145.text: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
145.flavorText: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

195.name: Mirror Entity
195.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
195.flavorText: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

1084.name: Mirror Image
1084.flavorText: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

1091.name: Misdirection
1091.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, instead it attacks another random character.
1091.flavorText: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

700.name: Mogu'shan Warden
700.flavorText: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King. BOOOORRRINNG!

1372.name: Molten Giant
1372.text: Costs (1) less for each Health your hero is missing.
1372.flavorText: He gets terrible heartburn. BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

467.name: Moonfire
467.flavorText: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

1092.name: Mortal Coil
1092.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
1092.flavorText: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

804.name: Mortal Strike
804.text: Deal 4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal 6 instead.
804.flavorText: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

993.name: Mountain Giant
993.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
993.flavorText: His mother said that he was just big boned.

292.name: Multi-Shot
292.text: Deal 3 damage to two random enemy minions.

191.name: Murloc Raider
191.flavorText: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

475.name: Murloc Tidecaller
475.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.
475.flavorText: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

1063.name: Murloc Warleader
1063.flavorText: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound? Nope! Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

1147.name: Nat Pagle
1147.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
1147.flavorText: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman! He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

60071.name: Natalie Seline
60071.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion and gain its Health.
60071.flavorText: She discovered Xal'atath, Blade of the Black Empire, a terrible weapon of shadow magic that could both swallow a soul and cut a mean julienne.

233.name: Naturalize
233.text: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.

670.name: Nightblade
670.flavorText: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

584.name: Noble Sacrifice
584.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.

89146.name: Nordrassil Druid
89146.text: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
89146.flavorText: The World Tree Nordrassil provides life-giving energy to the world--and excellent mana savings.

1650.name: Northshire Cleric
1650.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
1650.flavorText: They help the downtrodden and distressed. Also they sell cookies.

95.name: Nourish
95.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
95.flavorText: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

284.name: Novice Engineer
284.flavorText: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

411.name: Nozdormu
411.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
411.flavorText: Time to write some flavor text.

1370.name: Oasis Snapjaw
1370.flavorText: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

113196.name: Obliterate
113196.text: Destroy a minion. Deal 3 damage to your hero.
113196.flavorText: Why is 6 afraid of 7? Because Obliterate 9!

995.name: Ogre Magi
995.flavorText: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

736.name: Old Murk-Eye
736.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
736.flavorText: He's a legend among murlocs. "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.

363.name: Onyxia
363.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
363.flavorText: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor. You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

113198.name: Overseer Frigidara
113198.text: Battlecry: Draw 2 spells. If they're both Frost spells, deal 2 damage to all enemies.

113199.name: Patchwerk
113199.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random minion in your opponent's hand, deck, and battlefield.
113199.flavorText: This card is so good, it might need patch work.

1133.name: Patient Assassin
1133.flavorText: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

391.name: Perdition's Blade
391.flavorText: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

52264.name: Pilfer
52264.text: Add a random card from another class to your hand.
52264.flavorText: The class is always greener on the other side of the board.

37.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
37.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
37.flavorText: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

783.name: Pit Lord
783.flavorText: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

54863.name: Plaguebringer
54863.flavorText: One sip and you've got the grippe.

77.name: Polymorph
77.text: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
77.flavorText: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

113186.name: Possessifier
113186.flavorText: Beating the best, being the best, and brainwashing the rest.

60067.name: Power Infusion
60067.flavorText: It infuses, it enthuses, it amuses!

846.name: Power Overwhelming
846.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
846.flavorText: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is. It's CRAZY bad! Maybe worse than that. Just don't do it.

613.name: Power Word: Shield
613.text: Give a minion +2 Health. Draw a card.
613.flavorText: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

503.name: Power of the Wild
503.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
503.flavorText: Never look a panther in the eye. Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'? Well, it's one of those.

1158.name: Preparation
1158.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (2) less.

424.name: Priestess of Elune
424.flavorText: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

9.name: Prophet Velen
9.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
9.flavorText: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

60066.name: Psychic Conjurer
60066.text: Battlecry: Copy a card in your opponent’s deck and add it to your hand.
60066.flavorText: "I see... a WISP? Why do you have a wisp?!"

89149.name: Pursuit of Justice
89149.text: Give +1 Attack to Silver Hand Recruits you summon this game.
89149.flavorText: "Is this about justice or just us?"

1087.name: Pyroblast
1087.flavorText: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

791.name: Questing Adventurer
791.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
791.flavorText: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

1155.name: Raging Worgen
1155.flavorText: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

374.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
374.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
374.flavorText: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord. Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

134.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
134.flavorText: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold. He'll take care of the rest.

257.name: Razorfen Hunter
257.flavorText: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once. ONCE.

445.name: Reckless Rocketeer
445.flavorText: One Insane Rocketeer. One Rocket full of Explosives. Infinite Fun.

104221.name: Reckoning
104221.text: Secret: After an enemy minion deals 3 or more damage, destroy it.
104221.flavorText: He would henceforth be known as "Karmerr, the Doom of Kazzak."

140.name: Redemption
140.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
140.flavorText: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time. It’s a mystery!

232.name: Repentance
232.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
232.flavorText: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

113197.name: Repulsive Gargantuan
113197.flavorText: "EW, YUCK, GROSS, ICKY-" "Stop, you're hurting my feelings!"

54834.name: Righteousness
54834.flavorText: Shield yourself in righteousness! It feels like a warm fuzzy blanket.

113195.name: Rime Sculptor
113195.text: Battlecry: Summon two 2/1 Rime Elementals with "Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to a random enemy."

113193.name: Rimefang Sword
113193.text: After your hero attacks, reduce the Cost of a spell in your hand by (1).

89144.name: Ritual of Doom
89144.text: Destroy a friendly minion. If you had 5 or more, summon a 5/5 Demon.
89144.flavorText: "Who wants to sing the Doom song?!"

1369.name: River Crocolisk
1369.flavorText: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

239.name: Rockbiter Weapon
239.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
239.flavorText: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

113188.name: Runeforging
113188.text: Draw a weapon. Spend a Corpse to reduce its Cost by (1).
113188.flavorText: I swear the runes are genuine!

1117.name: SI:7 Agent
1117.flavorText: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities. Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

54836.name: SI:7 Infiltrator
54836.flavorText: What will she destroy? It’s a secret!

163.name: Sacrificial Pact
163.text: Destroy a friendly Demon. Restore 5 Health to your hero.
163.flavorText: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

461.name: Sap
461.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.

58489.name: Satyr Overseer
58489.text: After your hero attacks, summon a 2/2 Satyr.
58489.flavorText: What he lacks in communication skills, he makes up for with highly responsive staffing allocations.

742.name: Savage Roar
742.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
742.flavorText: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze". It's probably not that, though.

481.name: Savagery
481.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
481.flavorText: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

1261.name: Savannah Highmane
1261.flavorText: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

642.name: Scarlet Crusader
642.flavorText: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

60069.name: Scarlet Subjugator
60069.text: Battlecry: Give an enemy minion -2 Attack until your next turn.
60069.flavorText: At the Scarlet Monastery, he learned the sacred art of kicking people when they're up.

1281.name: Scavenging Hyena
1281.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
1281.flavorText: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything. Even Brussels sprouts.

211.name: Sea Giant
211.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.

158.name: Secretkeeper
158.flavorText: Where is Mankrik’s wife? She’ll never tell.

113351.name: Selective Breeder
113351.text: Battlecry: Discover a copy of a Beast in your deck.
113351.flavorText: His ethics are top notch. Just look at that smiling kitty!

635.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
635.flavorText: Sen'jin Village is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

860.name: Sense Demons
860.flavorText: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

914.name: Shadow Bolt
914.flavorText: It’s a Bolt. It's made out of Shadow. What more do you need to know!

220.name: Shadow Madness
220.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
220.flavorText: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

1363.name: Shadow Word: Death
1363.text: Destroy a minion with 5 or more Attack.
1363.flavorText: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

1367.name: Shadow Word: Pain
1367.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
1367.flavorText: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

60070.name: Shadow Word: Ruin
60070.text: Destroy all minions with 5 or more Attack.
60070.flavorText: Discovered by a worgen priest after a giant spilled a drink on her new white robes.

113182.name: Shadowed Spirit
113182.text: Deathrattle: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
113182.flavorText: They can't all be grim grinning ghosts.

147.name: Shadowflame
147.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
147.flavorText: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

1368.name: Shadowform
1368.flavorText: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

56806.name: Shadowhoof Slayer
56806.text: Battlecry: Give your hero +1 Attack this turn.
56806.flavorText: Was a humble Elven Archer before Sargeras got to him.

365.name: Shadowstep
365.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
365.flavorText: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance. Crowds love it.

608.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
608.flavorText: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

1023.name: Shield Block
1023.flavorText: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

546.name: Shield Slam
546.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
546.flavorText: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

866.name: Shieldbearer
866.flavorText: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game?? This is no easy job.

54835.name: Siegebreaker
54835.flavorText: Has a side hustle as a siegebroker.

56973.name: Sightless Watcher
56973.text: Battlecry: Look at 3 cards in your deck. Choose one to put on top.
56973.flavorText: What he lacks in sight, he makes up for in sleight-of-tentacle tricks.

1189.name: Silence
1189.flavorText: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

69.name: Silver Hand Knight
69.flavorText: It's good to be a knight. Less so to be one's squire.

67.name: Silverback Patriarch
67.flavorText: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

34.name: Silvermoon Guardian
34.flavorText: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

710.name: Sinister Strike
710.text: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
710.flavorText: There's something about this strike that just feels off. Sinister, even.

1100.name: Siphon Soul
1100.text: Destroy a minion. Restore 3 Health to your hero.
1100.flavorText: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul. You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

1074.name: Slam
1074.text: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
1074.flavorText: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

455.name: Snake Trap
455.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
455.flavorText: Why did it have to be snakes?

814.name: Snipe
814.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal 6 damage to it.
814.flavorText: A great sniper hits the spot. Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

614.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
614.text: Your spells cost (1) less (but not less than 1).
614.flavorText: Apprentices are great for bossing around. "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee! Make that a mana coffee!"

57732.name: Soul Cleave
57732.text: Lifesteal Deal 2 damage to two random enemy minions.
57732.flavorText: The way to a demon's soul is through its stomach.

381.name: Soul of the Forest
381.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."

974.name: Soulfire
974.text: Deal 4 damage. Discard a random card.
974.flavorText: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

680.name: Southsea Captain
680.flavorText: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat. He has hat envy.

724.name: Southsea Deckhand
724.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
724.flavorText: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

366.name: Spellbender
366.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
366.flavorText: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild. It just feels meaner. And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

754.name: Spellbreaker
754.flavorText: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders. The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

61.name: Spiteful Smith
61.text: Your weapon has +2 Attack while this is damaged.
61.flavorText: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

1371.name: Stampeding Kodo
1371.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
1371.flavorText: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

86.name: Starfall
86.text: Choose One - Deal 5 damage to a minion; or 2 damage to all enemy minions.
86.flavorText: Is the sky falling? Yes. Yes it is.

823.name: Starfire
823.flavorText: Balance is important to druids. This card is perfectly balanced.

1241.name: Starving Buzzard
1241.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
1241.flavorText: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

413.name: Stormpike Commando
413.flavorText: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts. They also bake a mean cupcake.

753.name: Stormwind Champion
753.flavorText: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

622.name: Stormwind Knight
622.flavorText: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

68.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
68.flavorText: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

969.name: Summoning Portal
969.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
969.flavorText: NOT LESS THAN 1! Don't get any ideas!

891.name: Sunfury Protector
891.flavorText: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

759.name: Sunwalker
759.flavorText: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun. It's just a name. Don’t worry!

64.name: Swipe
64.text: Deal 4 damage to an enemy and 1 damage to all other enemies.
64.flavorText: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe! ... or hug.

643.name: Sword of Justice
643.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
643.flavorText: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

1721.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
1721.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
1721.flavorText: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

45.name: Tauren Warrior
45.flavorText: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

1364.name: Temple Enforcer
1364.flavorText: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

962.name: The Beast
962.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Pip Quickwit for your opponent.
962.flavorText: He lives in Blackrock Mountain. He eats Gnomes. That's pretty much it.

1656.name: The Black Knight
1656.flavorText: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament. We can pretty much mark that a failure.

30.name: Thoughtsteal
30.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.
30.flavorText: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc? Nothing!" - Tauren joke

765.name: Thrallmar Farseer
765.flavorText: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

606.name: Timber Wolf
606.flavorText: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

570.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
570.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
570.flavorText: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

890.name: Tirion Fordring
890.flavorText: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

52262.name: Tome of Intellect
52262.text: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.
52262.flavorText: Just a compilation of napkins of intellect.

1047.name: Tracking
1047.flavorText: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

847.name: Truesilver Champion
847.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 3 Health to it.
847.flavorText: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

699.name: Tundra Rhino
699.flavorText: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos. Or am I mistaken?

1037.name: Twilight Drake
1037.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
1037.flavorText: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy. And Tacos.

859.name: Twisting Nether
859.flavorText: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

774.name: Unbound Elemental
774.text: After you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
774.flavorText: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

1243.name: Unleash the Hounds
1243.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
1243.flavorText: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

511.name: Upgrade!
511.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.

103101.name: Vanessa VanCleef
103101.text: Combo: Add a copy of the last card your opponent played to your hand.
103101.flavorText: Some people collect stamps or flowers. She collects enemies.

196.name: Vanish
196.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

286.name: Vaporize
286.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
286.flavorText: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card. We may never know the truth.

1122.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
1122.flavorText: No Job is too big. No fee is too big.

1029.name: Violet Teacher
1029.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
1029.flavorText: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig. And then you get your name on the board.

1221.name: Void Terror
1221.text: Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.
1221.flavorText: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

48.name: Voidwalker
48.flavorText: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

132.name: Voodoo Doctor
132.flavorText: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

89145.name: War Cache
89145.text: Add a random Warrior minion, spell, and weapon to your hand.
89145.flavorText: It's much tidier than Illidan's storage locker.

712.name: War Golem
712.flavorText: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them. Instinct, maybe? A desire to blend in?

1009.name: Warsong Commander
1009.text: Whenever you summon a minion with 3 or less Attack, give it Charge.
1009.flavorText: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

89150.name: Warsong Outrider
89150.flavorText: When it comes to the Warsong clan, outriders are the insiders.

395.name: Water Elemental
395.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
395.flavorText: Don't summon a water elemental at a party. It'll dampen the mood.

636.name: Whirlwind
636.flavorText: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

1124.name: Wild Growth
1124.flavorText: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

1014.name: Wild Pyromancer
1014.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
1014.flavorText: BOOM BABY BOOM! BAD IS GOOD! DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

51.name: Windfury
51.flavorText: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

567.name: Windfury Harpy
567.flavorText: Harpies are not pleasant sounding. That's the nicest I can put it.

178.name: Windspeaker
178.flavorText: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

179.name: Wisp
179.flavorText: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode. But why?

289.name: Wolfrider
289.flavorText: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

994.name: Worgen Infiltrator
994.flavorText: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

836.name: Wrath
836.text: Choose One - Deal 3 damage to a minion; or 1 damage and draw a card.
836.flavorText: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

556.name: Xavius
556.text: After you play a card, summon a 2/1 Satyr.
556.flavorText: Xavius has grand nightmares of summoning Sargeras into this world, but a few Satyr will have to do for now.

113194.name: Ymirjar Deathbringer
113194.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Spend 3 Corpses to summon a 3/3 Risen Ymirjar with Taunt.
113194.flavorText: Purple cotton candy is the snack of choice in Ymirheim.

641.name: Young Dragonhawk
641.flavorText: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

1634.name: Young Priestess
1634.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
1634.flavorText: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

415.name: Youthful Brewmaster
415.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
415.flavorText: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews. Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

1186.name: Ysera
1186.text: At the end of your turn, get two random Dream cards.
1186.flavorText: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream. Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

113184.name: Ysera the Dreamer
113184.text: Battlecry: Add one of each Dream card to your hand.
113184.flavorText: Quick! Quick! Write it down before you forget them all!
